title: Provides for the types of damages that may be awarded to the persons for whose benefit an action for wrongful death is brought
summary: Provides for the types of damages that may be awarded to the persons for whose benefit an action for wrongful death is brought i.e. grief and anguish; loss of love, society, protection, comfort, companionship and consortium; reasonable funeral expenses; reasonable expenses for medical care, treatment etc. prior to death; pecuniary injuries due to loss of services, support, inheritance; and loss of nurture, guidance or education.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the estates, powers and trusts law, in relation to payment and distribution of damages in wrongful death actions
